Home CV

Kushagra Garg

Hi there! I’m a Research Scientist at Fujitsu Research, where I focus on developing quantum algorithms for efficiently simulating open quantum systems.

Before this, I was fortunate to spend time at Microsoft Research, where I worked with Nishanth Chandran on applying cryptography to enable secure inference for large language models.

I completed my Master’s at IIIT Hyderabad, where I explored quantum algorithms for intermediate-term quantum devices, advised by Shantanav Chakraborty and Subhadip Mitra.

Publications

  1. K. Garg, Z. Ahmed, S. Mitra, S. Chakraborty. “Simulating quantum collision models with Hamiltonian simulations using early fault-tolerant quantum computers.” Physical Review A, 2025. DOI

  2. K. Garg, Z. Ahmed, A. Thomasen. “Entanglement determination with a deep multiscale entanglement renormalization ansatz.” Physical Review A, 2025. DOI

  3. Z. Ahmed, A. Chaudhuri, K. S. S. Grover, A. Rao, K. Garg, P. Malhotra. “Classifying CELESTE as NP Complete.” arXiv preprint, 2020. arXiv:2012.07678

Contact

Email: kushargsg@gmail.com

Feel free to reach out for research collaborations, discussions about quantum computing, or any questions about my work.
